thread.title: Janet Jackson moves Las Vegas stop to May to rest her voice
thread.title_full: Janet Jackson moves Las Vegas stop to May to rest her voice

title: Janet Jackson moves Las Vegas stop to May to rest her voice
text:
Janet Jackson moves Las Vegas stop to May to rest her voice Janet Jackson moves Las Vegas stop to May to rest her voice 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Janet Jackson has been forced to call off her Las Vegas tour dates because of problems with her voice. 
The US music star is cancelling her October 9 and 10 shows at Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino to rest her vocal cords, and the Vegas stop on her Unbreakable tour will now move to a new 20,000-seat arena in May 2016. 
Live Nation Entertainment said that ticketholders will be refunded and have the first chance to buy tickets for the May 14 performance. Tickets go on sale on October 16. (Chris Pizzello/AP) 
The move is a loss for Caesars Entertainment Corp, which owns the venue at Planet Hollywood that features regular performances by Britney Spears and soon Jennifer Lopez. 
MGM Resorts International is working with concert presenter AEG to open the new arena behind MGM’s New York-New York and Monte Carlo resorts in April. Excited to share #UNBREAKABLE with you all! New album out now on @AppleMusic : http://t.co/T5lhu3Y6tK -Janet’s Team https://t.co/8LINBXqeIr 
— Janet Jackson (@JanetJackson) October 2, 2015 Share article 
Jackson’s comeback album, Unbreakable, is out now. Promoted Stories
